Nanny pleads not guilty in death of Cambridge child

Aisling McCarthy Brady is charged with assaulting an infant and inflicting severe head injuries and was held on $500,000 bail, officials said. (Globe, 12:13 p.m.)

Bitter cold moves into region tonight

An Arctic front is expected to drive inland regions into the single digits while sinking Boston temperatures to 10 degrees and a wind chill of 8-below zero. (Globe, 11:32 a.m.)

3-alarm fire races through Lynn home

The fire struck a multi-family home at 57 Murray St. just before 11 a.m. (Boston Globe, 12:23 p.m.)

US home sales at 5-year high in 2012

Sales reached 4.65 million last year, up 9.2 percent from 2011, but short of the mark consistent with a health market, a real estate group reported. (AP, 11 a.m.)
  • 12/27 Mass. homes sales, median prices, both jump

Business

The fork that knew too much

The HAPIfork contains a motion-detection chip, like the ones used by smartphones to re-orient the screen when you tilt it. It acts as a constant reminder to slow down and savor every bite.
